title: Question 6

children: A 35-year-old man is evaluated for fever, night sweats, and
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is Hodgkin lymphoma. This patient has greatly enlarged cervical lymph nodes caused by Hodgkin lymphoma. Eighty to ninety percent of patients with Hodgkin lymphoma present with painless lymphadenopathy and may have B symptoms (fever, night sweats, weight loss).

objective.__html: Diagnose Hodgkin lymphoma presenting as massive cervical lymphadenopathy.
